proof:
Proof. Let $F \in \Omega_C^{\mathrm{dis}}$. Then $|F| \leq \eta|E_C|$, and thus $w_C(F) \leq q^{n_c} (e^\beta - 1)^{\eta|E_C|}$. $|\Omega_C^{\mathrm{dis}}| \leq 2^{|E_C|}$, and since $F = E_C$ is a configuration, $Z_C \geq q(e^\beta-1)^{|E_C|}$. Whp $|E_C| \leq \frac{dn}{2} + \eta n$, hence $|\Omega_C^{\mathrm{dis}}| \leq 2^{n(d/2+\eta)}$. Combining the inequalities and using that $\beta \geq \beta_1$,
$$ \frac{Z_C^{\mathrm{dis}}}{Z_C} \leq 2^{(d/2+\eta)n} q^{n_c} (e^\beta - 1)^{-(1-\eta)|E_C|} \leq q^{n-(1-\eta)(2+1/10)|E_C|}. $$
Lemma 39 gives us that whp $|E_C| \geq \frac{dn}{2} - 2ne^{-d/3}$, thus we get that
$$ \frac{Z_C^{\mathrm{dis}}}{Z_C} \leq q^{n[1-(1-\eta)(2+1/10)(d/2-2e^{-d/3})/d]} \leq q^{-n[1/20+2\eta+5e^{-d/3}/d]} $$
By the choice of $\eta$, for all $d$ large enough this is at most $q^{-n/40}$. Hence for all $q$ large enough, it is at most $e^{-n}$.
